pull.title: [qa] Add --failfast option to functional test runner
pull.body:
Add the option (`--failfast`) to stop the functional test runner's execution when it encounters the first failure.

Also cleans up run_test's arguments list ([no more mutable default for `args`](http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments)) and call site.

events.body: @MarcoFalke thanks for the look. I've addressed the formatting nit and the process cleanup issue you pointed out.
Concept ACK. Any reason not to enable this for Travis?
@theuni good point; I guess that'd encourage a shift in compute consumption onto developers who write buggy code vs. scarce Travis resources. Will add.

events.message:
Add --failfast option to functional test runner

Also cleans up run_test's arguments list (no more mutable default for `args`)
and call site.
Use --failfast when running functional tests on Travis

events.body:
Tested ACK 58f9a0a002ce45597ce2ed9e1902fb6ac608f014
I made the first test that runs here (`wallet_hd.py`) fail.
Without `--failfast` it continues after the error.
With `--failfast` it stopped immediately.

Make vpwallets usage thread safe

issue.title: Backport "--failfast" and "--ci" for test_runner.py
issue.body: This backports bitcoin#13105 and bitcoin#14630. One test is current timing out in #3277, causing Travis and Gitlab to timeout without any meaningful info. This PR will allow us to debug such cases.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -283,9 +284,22 @@ def main():
     if not args.keepcache:
         shutil.rmtree("%s/test/cache" % config["environment"]["BUILDDIR"], ignore_errors=True)
 
-    run_tests(test_list, config["environment"]["SRCDIR"], config["environment"]["BUILDDIR"], tmpdir, args.jobs, args.coverage, passon_args, args.combinedlogslen)
+    run_tests(
+        test_list,
+        config["environment"]["SRCDIR"],
+        config["environment"]["BUILDDIR"],
+        tmpdir,
+        jobs=args.jobs,
+        enable_coverage=args.coverage,
+        args=passon_args,
+        combined_logs_len=args.combinedlogslen,
+        failfast=args.failfast,
+    )
+
+def run_tests(test_list, src_dir, build_dir, tmpdir,
+              jobs=1, enable_coverage=False, args=None, combined_logs_len=0, failfast=False):
comments.body: nit: Can keep this in one line, so that it doesn't break when you e.g. grep for `run_tests`.
